content.raw:
I was testing by running an unthrottled version of `sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world` with gzserver and watching the real-time factor with gzstats. As of this writing, the gazebo_1.8 branch was getting a real-time factor between 3.65 and 3.75, while the island_thread branch showed promise with RTF as high as 4.5 but also a downside with lows near 2.5.

The VRC tasks may have better performance with less downside, but this is a big warning flag to me that it can make performance worse.
content.html:
I was testing by running an unthrottled version of sdf/worlds/revolute_joint_test.world with gzserver and watching the real-time factor with gzstats. As of this writing, the gazebo_1.8 branch was getting a real-time factor between 3.65 and 3.75, while the island_thread branch showed promise with RTF as high as 4.5 but also a downside with lows near 2.5.

The VRC tasks may have better performance with less downside, but this is a big warning flag to me that it can make performance worse.
